name: phylum
description: Phylum is a static analysis tool that runs as a self-hosted web app, designed to evaluate software supply chain risks by analyzing dependencies and code security.
features: Dependency analysis: Scan project dependencies to identify security vulnerabilities and supply chain risks.
Risk scoring: Assign risk scores to packages based on security, quality, and maintenance indicators.
Vulnerability detection: Identify known CVEs and security issues in third-party dependencies.
License compliance: Track and report on software licenses to ensure compliance with organizational policies.
Package monitoring: Continuously monitor dependencies for new vulnerabilities and updates.
Web dashboard: View analysis results and risk reports through an intuitive web interface.
Multi-language support: Analyze dependencies from npm, PyPI, Maven, and other package ecosystems.
CI/CD integration: Integrate security checks into build pipelines to catch issues before deployment.
Historical tracking: Monitor how dependency risks change over time with trend analysis.
Policy enforcement: Define and enforce security policies for acceptable dependency risk levels.
Detailed reports: Generate comprehensive reports on package security, quality, and maintainability.
Alert notifications: Receive notifications when high-risk dependencies are detected in projects.
